gw.api.bean.compare

Class EntityMatcher<T extends KeyableBean>

  • gw.api.bean.compare.EntityMatcher<T>

  • public class EntityMatcher<T extends KeyableBean>
    Interface for matching two different entity instances to determine if they logically represent the same entity. Semantics are identical to <code>gw.api.diff.BeanMatcher#doBeansMatch(gw.pl.persistence.core.entity.KeyableBean, gw.pl.persistence.core.entity.KeyableBean) BeanMatcher</code>.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean doEntitiesMatch(KeyableBean source, KeyableBean compare)
      Determine if two beans are really the same "thing" -- i.e. they represent the same logical entity. For example, a entity.Person might be considered to match another entity.Person if they have the same TaxID.
      Comparator<KeyableBean> getMatchPrioritizer(KeyableBean toBeMatched)
      To assist with the case where there are multiple matches for an entity, this method returns a {@link Comparator} to determine the closest match.

    • Method Detail

      • doEntitiesMatch

        boolean doEntitiesMatch(KeyableBean source,
                      KeyableBean compare)
        Determine if two beans are really the same "thing" -- i.e. they represent the same logical entity. For example, a entity.Person might be considered to match another entity.Person if they have the same TaxID.
        Parameters:
        source - The source entity
        compare - The entity against which the source is compared
        Returns:
        True if the two entities are logically the same entity

      • getMatchPrioritizer

        Comparator<KeyableBean> getMatchPrioritizer(KeyableBean toBeMatched)
        To assist with the case where there are multiple matches for an entity, this method returns a {@link Comparator} to determine the closest match.
        Parameters:
        toBeMatched - The bean that is being matched; all other beans passed to the comparator are assumed to match this bean
        Returns:
        The comparator where lower sort order indicates higher priority
